Privacy Policy

Artificial Life Institute

Date created: May 21, 2025

This Privacy Policy ("Policy") describes how the Artificial Life Institute (hereinafter "the Institute") handles personal information in accordance with the Act on the Protection of Personal Information and related laws and guidelines in Japan.

Article 1: Compliance with Laws and Regulations

The Institute complies with the Act on the Protection of Personal Information and all other relevant laws, regulations, and guidelines (hereinafter "Applicable Laws").

Article 2: Management System

The Institute shall take necessary and appropriate measures to prevent leakage, loss, or damage of personal data as defined in Article 2(6) of the Act, and shall ensure safe management of such data. The Institute shall also appropriately supervise its staff and contractors handling personal data.

Article 3: Acquisition of Personal Information

The Institute shall acquire personal information by lawful and appropriate means to the extent necessary for achieving the purposes defined in the next article.

Article 4: Purpose of Use

The Institute will use personal information only within the scope necessary for the following purposes:

  • - Operation, implementation, and management of the Institute's various programs
  • - Stakeholder management, including donors, supporters, and members
  • - Billing and payment processing
  • - Responses to inquiries and communications related to the Institute
  • - Notifications regarding amendments to the Institute's policies, rules, or other important matters
  • - Providing information about products or services related to the Institute or its affiliates
  • - Publication in the Institute's website or promotional materials
  • - Survey and analysis of the Institute's activities

The Institute may revise the purpose of use when reasonably related to the original purpose. In such cases, the Institute shall notify the individual or publicly announce the change on its website or other accessible means.

Article 5: Anonymized Information

The Institute may process personal information into anonymized or statistical information in accordance with Applicable Laws and use such data.

Article 6: Provision to Third Parties

The Institute will not provide personal data to third parties without the individual's consent, except in the following cases:

  • - When outsourcing all or part of the handling of personal data within the scope necessary to achieve the stated purposes
  • - In case of business succession due to merger or other reasons
  • - When personal data is used jointly with a specified party, and such information (scope, purpose, responsible party) is notified to the individual or made easily accessible
  • - As otherwise permitted by the Act or other Applicable Laws

Article 7: Joint Use

When jointly using personal data with third parties, the Institute will ensure appropriate management in accordance with Applicable Laws.

Article 8: Rights of the Individual

If an individual requests notification of purpose, disclosure, correction, addition, deletion, suspension of use, or erasure (hereinafter "disclosure, etc.") of their personal data held by the Institute, we will respond without delay after confirming the identity of the individual. However, if the Institute is not legally obligated to comply, the request may be denied.

Article 9: Policy Revision

The Institute shall continuously review and improve its handling of personal information and may revise this Policy as necessary. Any changes will be announced via the Institute's website, email, or other appropriate methods.

Article 10: Contact

For inquiries regarding the handling of personal information, requests for disclosure, or complaints, please contact:

Artificial Life Institute

Secretariat

Email: staff@alife.institute
